replies.msg:
ok, lets try a different concept:
lets talk about breaking up. Breaking up might be attributed to multiple reasons, including but not limited to; cheating, lost of interest etc. But can one deny that breaking up is just another rejection? It is the act of which one actively denies his/her partners' love, be it for any reasons. Therefore we should see breaking up in material, the same as a rejection.

Now coming back to address the topic, is there any difference if one is denied a relationship ab initio than to one who is deferred the inevitable, only to be rejected at a later time? I think not, because for any reasons the deferred rejection might be, it does not hold itself a different meaning to the normal standards of a rejection, hence in my eyes a breaking up is nothing more than a rejection subject to conditions.
